intro: Silene scottii, commonly known as the Scott's campion, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Scottish Highlands. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and is adapted to cold, moist conditions. Silene scottii is a perennial species that blooms from June to August, producing small, clustered flowers. It is considered a rare and protected species due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements.
